So there's the elbow that's pulling obviously
But the other part of it that we often don't think about and this is where I see you guys going on with it is the scapula or the shoulder blade
Okay, so scapula is here attached to the back and this is actually the bigger part of the pulling action
So what I want to think when I'm doing a pull up or a chin up is that I'm going to mobilize or pull with the scapula first
Right, so if you have a look from the side here
You'll see my arm stays straight. I pull through the scapula and then lastly I pull through the arms
Okay, coming down would be the reverse order. I would straighten the arms and then I would undo the scapula
Now the reason this is important is because by using the scapulas and getting that retraction and depression of the scap
I'm accessing all of the muscle of the back
